intro: Micrechites, commonly known as the "dwarf milkweed," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, delicate flowers and milky sap, which is a common trait among members of the Apocynaceae family. Micrechites species typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. They are often found in regions of North America, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The genus includes several species, each with unique floral structures and growth habits adapted to their specific ecological niches.
